question: You have had a bank account for a few years. Recently you received a letter from the hank stating that your account is $240 overdrawn and that you will he charged $70 which will he taken directly from your account. You know that this information is incorrect.  Write a letter to the bank. Explain what has happened and say what you would like them to do about it.
text: My name is Kulwinder Kaur having a personal and saving account in your bank for the last 12 years. My account number is 9870652790. I am writing this letter to raise my concern regarding a letter I just received from the bank. In this letter, the statement shows that I overdrawn the amount of $240 from my account and will be charged for extra $70 for this overdraft.

Please note that I am not using this account for the last 6 months and I also sent an email to your institution for the closure of this account but did not get any response. Afterwards, I tried to withdraw the remaining amount from my account but the transaction failed and I was also notified notify by the same of the bank. Hence I presume that it may be a clerical error you may check my account for detailed clarification.
I request you to kindly check my concern regarding this transaction and look forward to hearing back from you.
